- Not Compliant  Low: Some breached constraints are based only on severities which are low (associated severities < system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Medium: Some breached constraints are based on severities which are medium (system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS <= associated severities < system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDateOperation.description:
Last Operation Date
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
Indicates the date of the last operation performed on all portfolios related to the client.
It is the most recent date of all Last Operation Date (extended attribute) on client portfolios.
The operation can be a buy, a sell, an investment, a withdrawal, a transfer, or a portfolio transfer. Its status must be greater or equal to Order and the nature of the Instrument can be a stock, a fixed income, an option, a future, a discount instrument, a fund share, an option bond, a convertible bond, or an exotic option.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDateProposal.description:
Last Proposal Date
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
Indicates the date of the last proposal performed on all portfolios related to the client.
A proposal is an order session (function result), related to a portfolio, whose session nature is equal to Investment Proposal and whose session status is equal to Sent to Client or Accepted

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDaysOperation.description:
Last Operation (in days)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
Indicates the number of days between the current date and the last operation performed on all portfolios related to the client.
It is the minimum value of all Last Operation (in days) (extended attribute) on client portfolios.
The operation can be a buy, a sell, an investment, a withdrawal, a transfer, or a portfolio transfer. Its status must be greater or equal to Order and the nature of the instrument can be a stock, a fixed income, an option, a future, a discount instrument, a fund share, an option bond, a convertible bond, or an exotic option.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDaysProposal.description:
Last Proposal (in days)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
Indicates the number of days between the current date and the last proposal performed on all portfolios related to the client.
A proposal is an order session (function result), related to a portfolio, whose session nature is equal to Investment Proposal and whose session status is equal to Sent to Client or Accepted

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extMifidCurStatus.description:
This attribute defines the status of the current MiFID profile of the client and can have the following permitted values:

0  None
1  No profile, no MiFID profile defined yet
2  Valid, the current MiFID profile is valid. Expiry date not reached
3  Expired, the current MiFID profile is expired.

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extMifidExpiryD.description:
This attributes defines the expiry date of the current MiFID profile.

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extMifidRvwStatus.description:
This attribute defines the status of the current review of the MiFID profile of the client and can have the following permitted values:

0  None, no review in progress
1  In progress, review in progress
2  Pending approval, review pending validation

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extObjCompliance.description:
Objectives Compliance
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

If Case Management is deactivated, the following values are allowed:

- Compliant: Actual weights are compliant compared to their objectives with margins.
- No Objectives: No objectives are defined on the investment structure.
- Not Compliant  High: Some actual weights are not compliant with their objectives with margins.
- Not Evaluated: Impossible to evaluate the objectives' compliance.

If Case Management is activated, the following values are allowed:

- Compliant: Actual weights are compliant compared to their objectives with margins.
- No Objectives: No objectives are defined on the investment structure.
- Not Compliant  High: Some non-compliant actual weights are based on severities which are high (associated severity >= system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Low: Some non-compliant actual weights are based only on severities which are low (associated severities < system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Medium: Some non- compliant actual weights are based on severities which are medium (system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS <= associated severities < system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Evaluated:It was impossible to evaluate the objectives' compliance.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extRefCur.description:
System Ccy.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the ISO code of the system currency, which is a synonym's value. If it is not available, the system currency's code is returned instead.
The definition of the synonym's code to be used is set through the parameter DS_CURRENCY_CODE (which is delivered with no values).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extRiskCompliance.description:
Risk Compliance is an extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation. In the standard packaging, this attribute is built from the results of the worst risk indicators of VaR %, Volatility %, Tracking Error %, Expected Shortfall %, Diversification Effect %, VaR amount, Expected Shortfall amount, Diversification Effect amount, Risk Grade, Volatility amount, Tracking Error amount, Shortfall Probability %, and Shortfall Probability amount.

For each indicator, the compliance is calculated as follows:

If Case Management is deactivated, the following values are allowed:
- Risk Compliant: Risk values are under risk objectives.
- No Risk Objectives: No risk objectives are defined in the portfolio.
- Not Risk Compliant: Some risk objectives are reached. 
- Not Evaluated: No risk values calculated.


If Case Management is activated, the following values are allowed:
- Risk Compliant: Risk values are under risk objectives.
- No Risk Objectives: No risk objectives are defined in the portfolio.
- Not Compliant  High: Some risk objectives are reached and are based on severities     that are high (associated severity >= system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Medium: Some risk objectives are reached and are based on severities that are medium (system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS <= associated severities < system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Low: Some risk objectives are reached and are based on severities that are low (associated severities < system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Evaluated: No risk values calculated.

This attribute is used only for the web packaging.

extTdMktValM.description:
Market Value (Sys. Ccy.)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the current market value of the client in system currency. It is the total market value, in system currency, of all portfolios related to the client.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the list
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead. At least, if no denominations are available, the name is used.
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

name.description: Short name of an occurrence. This short name has not to be unique.

natureE.description: Defines the nature of a list in the application. These nature implies different type of processing within the application, see description of each permitted value.

queryDefinition.description:
This attribute is only used for the Web packaging.
This Field contains the query definition used by the dynamic search.

typeCode.description: Reference to the type of a list.

validityPeriod.description:
Number of days after the last reconstruction of a constrained list according to constraint definition, for which the enumerated list is deemed valid.

Special values:
NULL - The list is rebuilt every time it is used
0    - The list is rebuilt only if any object from one of the underlying entity (portfolio, instrument etc...) was modified. The system performs a check using all entities listed in the constraint definition.

E.g. a portfolio group is defined as all portfolios managed by 'Smith' and with a reference currency equal to USD. For performance reasons this list instead of being systematically recomputed at request, is in fact stored as an enumerated list (although the definition is also associated to the list occurrence). Manager 'Smith' specifies however that the composition of the list should never be older than 7 days. When a request to use this list is made, the system checks that the last reconstruction date is not older than the current date less the validity period.

Instrument price or exchange rate types that  have a rank of 0 are not included in the default price process, e.g. fiscal prices.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination. This is the denomination of the balance position type. Denomination is displayed in the user's language but if it is not available, then the default translation is used instead. If no denominations are available, then the name is used.

It is an extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation (refer to the Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too. 

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationDe.description:
Denomination in German. This is the denomination of the balance position type in German. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as "multilingual" and the language German too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationEn.description:
Denomination in English. This is the denomination of the balance position type in English. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as "multilingual" and the language English too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationFr.description:
Denomination in French. This is the denomination of the balance position type in French. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as "multilingual" and the language French too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

This is an extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation (refer to the Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity. 

This attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

name.description: Short name of an occurrence. This short name does not have to be unique.

natureE.description: Specifies the nature of a Balance Position Type which characterises a 'Balance Position'. The list of permitted values is set by Odyssey and cannot be modified. These natures are important because they are used intensively in the Fusion process and, subsequently, in functions such as 'Performance Measurement' and 'Performance Attribution'.

rankN.description:
Associates a 'Position' and 'Balance Position' to a Balance Position Type.
A Balance Position with a rank less than or equal to 10 must have a nature of 'Position Fee' or 'Position Tax'. Note that there can only be one BP Type with such a rank.
The amounts corresponding to these BP Types are stored in one of the corresponding 'BP Amount' in the position/balance position tables, and shows the difference between the position gross and net amounts.

deleteRightF.description:
A TSL attribute that cannot be edited by the user but can be redefined with default values. It is used to define whether a WealthSuite Front Office - Portfolio Management (PM) Web user is allowed to delete the corresponding business entity.

As mentioned, its value can be overriden by default values. If no default values are applied, its value is set to TRUE if the Front Office - PM Web user's data profile contains the business entity's Data Security Profile with deletion rights granted.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

Denomination of the business entity. This extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation (for more information, refer to the WealthSuite Front Office - Portfolio Management Web - TSL Operating Guide).

The denomination is displayed in the user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead. At the very least, if no denominations are available, then the name is used. As well, this extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

This attribute makes sense only in a multi-entity configuration.
It defines if the business entity contributes to the multi-entity organization.

orgaRoleE.description: Defines the organisation of the business entity inside the bank's organisation.

phoneC.description: Telephone number of the business entity.

referenceE.description:
Defines the reference of the business entity.

A reference is a system (such as T24 back-office system) that is the data master concerning the bank's organisation.

statusE.description: Defines the status of the business entity.

telexC.description: Mask number of the business entity.

themeC.description:
This attribute makes sense only in a multi-entity configuration.
This attribute is a simple text that conditions the front-ends layout.  
When, in the front-end, a user switches from one business entity to another business entity that has a different theme, the color changes accordingly. This reminds the user where he is logged into.
The standard packaging delivers some theme examples where the value is simply associated to a color: 
- red
- darkBlue
- purple
- green
- blue
- orange
When not defined: grey for WUI and Connect. 
The usage of themes for conditioning the front-end layout can be extended by customization.

Only one default login can be set between a user and a business entity.

criticalnessE.description:
This attribute determines the constraint's severity.
This attribute is checked regarding the value of system parameters:
1. SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS: 
when the Case Management Component is activated, the constraint's severity could block the Order Session (criticalness' value > system parameter's one).
2. STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS: 
   2.1. for Constraint Breach feature, the attribute's value determines the degree to which a constraint is blocking when a portfolio manager wants to pass orders.
   2.2. using Case Management Component, this value determines what are Cases that must be clarified.

accrualRuleE.description:
Specifies the method used to compute the number of days between two dates. For yield curves, the value defines the calendar convention for interpolation in the dates.

The following information applies to accrual rules 19 to 31.

DATATYPE CALCONV (file main/cldr.h, version 1.68, line 92)

CALCONV: data type for calendar conventions
--------------------------------------------


            ACTACT
            ACTLEAP
            ACTAFB
            ACTEUROBOND
            ACTFRF
            EU30360
            EU30E360
            EU30E365
            US30360
            US30E360
            ACT365
            ACTNL365
            ACT360
            EU30EP360
CALCONV

The main purpose of the calendar convention is to define the day count fraction used, e.g. when computing accrued interest over a certain time period. The day count fraction is in general computed as:

Number of days in period / Number of days per year.

The time period in question is defined to go from, and including, the period start date  to, but excluding, the period end date.

The definition of these is described below, followed by a short note on market practice.

The definitions are in accordance with the ISMA publication "Bond Markets: Structures and Yield Calculations" (1998) by Patrick Brown and the ISDA note "Emu and Market Conventions: Recent Developments" (1998).

Number of days in period
------------------------

For the ACT based conventions, ACTACT, ACTLEAP, ACTAFB, ACTEUROBOND, ACTFRF, ACT365, ACT360, the number of days between the two dates is computed as the actual number of calendar days in the period, including 29 February if it occurs in the period. For ACTNL365, which is used in Japan, 29 February is never counted.

For the 30-day month based conventions, EU30360, EU30E360, EU30E365, EU30EP360, US30360, US30E360, the number of days between two days - written on the form day-month-year as d1m1y1 and d2m2y2 - is computed according to the formula:

        360 * (y2 - y1) + 30 * (m2 - m1) + (d2 - d1)

where the original dates are modified according to the rules below:

EU30360, US30360 convention (also know as the "30-day month U.S. method"):

        If d1 = 31 then d1 is set to 30.
        If d2 = 31 and modified d1 = 30 then d2 is set to 30.

EU30E365, EU30E365, US30E360 convention (also known as the "30-day European method"):

        If d1 = 31 then d1 is set to 30.
        If d2 = 31 then d2 is set to 30.

EU30EP360 convention:

        If d1 = 31 then d1 is set to 30.
        If d2 = 31 then d2 is set to 1, m2 (and possibly y2) is updated to next month.

Number of days per year
-----------------------          .

For the 360-days conventions, EU30360, EU30E360, EU30EP360, US30360, US30E360, ACT360, the number of days per year is 360.

For the 365-days conventions, EU30E365, ACT365, ACTNL365, the number of days per year is 365.

For the actual-days conventions, ACTACT, ACTLEAP, ACTAFB, ACTEUROBOND, ACTFRF, the number of days per year is the actual number of days per year, differing in the processing of leap years in the following manner:

ACTACT convention: The number of days per year is the actual number of days from the period start date and one year ahead.

ACTAFB: If the period is shorter than one year then the number of days is 366 if 29 February occurs in the period. Otherwise it is 365.

If the period is longer than one year then the period is split into one year sub-periods -counting backwards from the period end date - plus the remaining initial stub period of length shorter than one year. The day count fraction is the sum over the day count fractions of the sub-periods. The stub period is treated in accordance with the first rule and the remaining year-long periods have a day count fraction of 1.

ACTEUROBOND: If the period equals a whole year, then the number of days per year equals the actual number of days in the period. If the period is not a whole year, then the number of days per year equals the number of days in the calendar year of the end period date.

ACTFRF: The number of days per year is the actual number of days from the end period date and one year back.

ACTLEAP: The period is split into the periods that are in leap and non-leap years. In the former periods the number of days per year is 366 while in the latter periods the number of days is 365. The day count fraction is the sum over the day count fractions of the sub-periods.

Market practice
---------------

The actual-actual calendar conventions, ACTACT, ACTLEAP, ACTAFB, ACTEUROBOND, ACTFRF, are used in the swap (floating leg) and bond markets. The recommendation to use actual-actual in the new euro denominations has highlighted the differences between the conventions even though they only differ in the number of days per year when considering leap years.

ACTACT              Original SCecon convention.

ACTLEAP             ISDA convention for swaps. It has been proposed
                    to switch to ACTAFB.
ACTAFB              AFB convention. Recommended new ISDA convention.
ACTEUROBOND         Used in the Eurobond market.
ACTFRF              Used in the French market.

The 30-month calendar conventions, EU30360, EU30E360, EU30E365, US30360, US30E360, EU30EP360, are used swap (fixed leg) and bond markets.

EU30360, US30360    Used in Finland
EU30E360, US30E360  Previous standard in Europe. Still used in Denmark,

                    Sweden, Holland, Belgium, and Austria.
EU30EP360           Used in Switzerland.

The actual-360 convention, ACT360, is used in money and swap (floating leg) markets.

The actual-365 conventions, ACT365 and ACTNL365, are used in Norway, Canada, and Japan.

activeF.description: Describes the state of the Financial Instrument. If a Financial Instrument is inactive (active_f=0), it is not displayed in the default selection lists.

beginD.description:
Specifies the date at which the Instrument exists or is issued. This attribute is purely informational for some Instruments. For bonds, it generally corresponds to the issue date. For Options, it specifies the date from which an option can be exercised. The option style is used in functions to distinguish between European and American Options.
If necessary, information on an Issue, particularly if it is in the future or if it is partial, can be stored in an Issue_or_Redemption Event.

capTaxRateP.description: Specifies the amount of capital gains applied to a position in this security.

complexityF.description:
This field is used to specify the complexity of an instrument. 
It could be initialised by a default value based on other attributes of the instruments such as the nature, the risk-nature, the currency, the market...

contractNatE.description: Specifies the default characteristics of a Futures contract for calculating conversion factors.
enum: CBOT fut. US bond & 10 yr note

contractSizeN.description:
The size of one contract. The general practice in option dealing is to trade contracts that cover a fixed quantity of underlying instruments, e.g. 3 option contracts to buy 100 IBM stock at 145 USD. The quantity for the above example is stored in the database as 300. The contract size is 100. The quantity displayed or entered by the user is 3 (quantity/contract size). 
The default value is 1.

cutoffTimeD.description:
Cut-off time is the deadline mutual fund company sets for investors to enter orders on this fund. 
When trade occurs after this time, the fund will be based on another net asset value.
The time format must be 24h. Example, enter 14:30 for 2:30 pm.

cutoffTimezoneCode.description: Defines the time zone where the cut-off time applies.

cutoffTimezoneName.description: Defines the time zone where the cut-off time applies.

denom.description: Long name of the occurrence (see the documentation on the multi-lingual features for information on changing languages).

endD.description: The date at which the Instrument ceases to exist. In theory, there must be no positions in this Instrument after the end date. In practice, however, due to possible administrative or financial delays, this may not always be the case. This field is not mandatory but if completed it must be greater than or equal to the Begin Date.

exerQuoteN.description:
Identifies the exercise quote (strike) applicable to the underlying instrument when the redemption quote is applicable to the instrument. It is used for structured products that embed terms and conditions relative to an underlying with a strike.

Applicable for structured product definition management.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the instrument.
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead. At least, if no denominations are available, the name is used.
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extIpoSubscriptionF.description:
Indicator to show that the IPO subscriptions are possible in the instrument. It is determined by the way of comparing the current date and if it is later than the subscription begin date and earlier than the date specified as cut-off date for the IPO subscription. 
0=Indicates that the IPO subscription is not enabled for the instrument (current date earlier than subscription begin date or later than cut off date)
1=Indicates that the IPO subscriptions are possible for the instrument(current date later than subscription begin date and earlier than cut off date)

extIsinSynC.description:
ISIN
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
It is the ISIN code of the instrument, which is in fact a synonym.
The definition of the synonym's code, to be used, has to be set through the parameter DS_ISIN_CODE_INSTRUMENT.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extLastPriceN.description:
Last Price

This is the last price of the instrument based on the system date. The INSTR_PRICE() keyword is used to display the value.

This extended attribute cannot be edited by the user and requires a data pre-computation (refer to the Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide). The attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extOngoingIpoF.description:
Indicator to show if the instrument, which came up with an IPO, is listed in the secondary market or not. 
0=Indicates that the IPO instrument is listed in the market (current date later than first dealing date)
1=1.	Indicates that the IPO instrument is not yet listed in the market (current date earlier than first dealing date)

extRatingC.description:
Rating
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
It is the rating of the instrument.
The definition of the rating's code, to be used, has to be set through the parameter DS_RATING_INSTRUMENT.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extSectorC.description:
Sector
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
It is the ISIC code of the instrument's sector.
The definition of the sector's code, to be used, has to be set through the parameter DS_SECTOR_INSTRUMENT

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extTelekursSynC.description:
Telekurs
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
It is the Telekurs code of the instrument, which is in fact a synonym.
The definition of the synonym's code, to be used, has to be set through the parameter DS_TELEKURS_CODE_INSTRUMENT.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

faceValueN.description: The smallest nominal value unit for a bond or face value of a share, expressed in the Currency of the Financial Instrument.

firstCoupD.description: Specifies the date at which the first coupon is paid.

fixD.description:
For structured products, it is the date at which the underlying price is determined to define the pay off of the instrument depending on the terms and conditions. 

Applicable for structured product definition management.

fundIncomeStyleE.description: Indicates, how earnings from the funds' constituents are handled by the fund management.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

interestRateP.description: The interest rate of income to be paid. The payment is always in the currency of the Instrument. This field is also used to indicate the nominal interest rate of a notional instrument (deliverable) that underlies a bond futures contract.

issueQtyN.description:
The actual number of Financial Instruments issued to the market.
Note that this is NOT the amount traded on the market.

issueQuoteN.description: Specifies the quote at which the instrument was issued.

issuerThirdCode.description: Specifies the third party that issued the instrument.

lastCoupD.description: For bonds, date at which the last coupon is paid.

marketThirdCode.description:
Specifies the main market in which the instrument is quoted.
This market is used in the default process for retrieving prices.

minTradeQtyN.description:
The minimum quantity of an instrument that may be traded. This field may be used in conjunction with the odd lot quantity.

For example, for a particular instrument, the minimum trade size may be 5000 units (minimum trade quantity) and then available in increments of 1000 (odd lot) thereafter.

minTradingAmtM.description: Defines the Minimum Trading Amount of an instrument below which trades are not executed at the market price.

natureE.description: Specifies the nature of the instrument. A mandatory hard-coded classifying attribute for distinctive processing.

negociableF.description: Specifies if the instrument is directly negotiable or not, e.g. a notional bond or an instrument that is generated for risk exposure purposes may not be negotiable.

oddLotQtyN.description: Minimum quantity of the instrument below which trades are not executed at the market price.

optStyleE.description: Specifies when the Option can be exercised.

optionClassE.description: Specifies if the holder of an Option has the right to buy or sell the underlying.

payFreqN.description:
For Bonds, this field specifies the number of payment frequency units between two payments.
For Stocks and Fund Shares, specifies the frequency of dividend payments.
For Options, specifies the frequency. 
For Rates whose subtype is set to Par yield, specifies the frequency of payoffs if the rate is a security with payoffs. Typically, this is used for rates that underly floating rate indexes, and CMT and CMS swaps where the underlying is a par yield rate of a 5-year Treasury.

payFreqUnitE.description:
Specifies the unit of the Payment Frequency.
See the description of the Payment Frequency attribute.
This attribute is complemented by the Frequency attribute that specifies the number of units, e.g. 1 week, 2 weeks, 4 months. The permitted values are:
0. No periodicity
4. Monthly
5. Quarterly
6. Semi-annually
7. Annually

portfolioCode.description: Specifies the portfolio to which a cash account belongs.

portfolioId.description: Specifies the portfolio to which a cash account belongs.

portfolioName.description: Specifies the portfolio to which a cash account belongs.

portfolioStatusE.description: Specifies the portfolio to which a cash account belongs.

portfolioThirdCode.description: Specifies the portfolio to which a cash account belongs.

priceCalcRuleE.description: Specifies the default method for obtaining the price from the quote of a financial instrument.

redempCodeE.description: Specifies if the Redemption data for this financial instrument is stored in the financial Instrument or the Issue_or_Redemption Events table.

redempQuoteN.description:
Market quotation of the exercise of a term contract expressed in a specific currency via a relationship. Can also be the market quotation of the redemption quote.
NB. Default price calculation rule of the underlying financial instrument.

refCurrCode.description: Specifies the currency of the instrument. For bond-like instruments, this is the currency of the principal.

refCurrDenom.description: Specifies the currency of the instrument. For bond-like instruments, this is the currency of the principal.

reinvestmentAllowedF.description:
Indicates if the fund offers a choice for the investor to decide, whether the dividends of the fund should be paid out or re-invested.
This field can only be set for instrument with fund_income_style_e set to Dividend.

riskCurrCode.description: Specifies the risk currency of the instrument.

riskCurrDenom.description: Specifies the risk currency of the instrument.

riskGeoCode.description: Specifies the risk country or area related to this instrument.

riskGeoDenom.description: Specifies the risk country or area related to this instrument.

riskLevelN.description: This field is used in conjunction with the investment profile risk level in order to check whether the instrument does not excess the risk level tolerated by the investment profile.

riskNatureE.description: Specifies the nature of the risk incurred by this instrument. The general processing of instruments attempts to mirror an instrument with "building block" instruments whose risk nature is 1, 2, 3 or 4.

roundLotAmtM.description:
Defines the Round Lot Amount of an instrument that may be traded. This field may be used in conjunction with Minimum Trading Amount. 

For example, the minimum Trading Amount can be 5000 EUR for a particular instrument and then, available only in increments of 1000 EUR (Round Lot Amount) thereafter.

subNatE.description:
This attribute provides a finer, hard-coded definition of an instrument. This is necessary for specific processing (e.g. exotic options) or for setting default values in the analytics (e.g. bonds).
Specifies the default characteristics in bond calculations. When this argument is passed to the bond analytics, specific processing is automatically performed (e.g. Italian bond day counting, capital gain tax, rounding of prices for municipal bonds, etc).
enum: US Gov agency bond, no Feb adj
Canadian govn, Bnk of Can conv
Reverse Convertibles Notes - Equity Linked Notes
Reverse Convertibles Notes - Bonds Linked Notes
Reverse Convertibles Notes - Credit Linked Notes

subtypeCode.description: Specifies the subtype of the instrument.

subtypeName.description: Specifies the subtype of the instrument.

switchOrderAmtF.description: Flag to determine if the instrument is allowed to switch in amount

switchOrderPercF.description: Flag to determine if the instrument is allowed to switch in percentage

switchOrderUnitF.description: Flag to determine if the instrument is allowed to switch in units

taxGeoCode.description: The country for which a tax rate must be retrieved, e.g. a Swiss franc Bond issued by IBM is subject to Swiss income tax or, to take another example, IBM quoted in Swiss francs is subject to US income tax.

taxGeoName.description: The country for which a tax rate must be retrieved, e.g. a Swiss franc Bond issued by IBM is subject to Swiss income tax or, to take another example, IBM quoted in Swiss francs is subject to US income tax.

taxRateP.description: Specifies the withholding tax applied in the payment of a coupon or dividend.

tickSizeN.description: Specifies the valid increment or decrement in the price of a financial instrument. The tick size amount can be defined using the script language if it is part of a more complex calculation.

tradeNatureE.description:
Specifies the Instrument Trade Nature.

It is useful for users who want to buy an instrument in the denomination of "Amount" (e.g., 1,000 EUR, 2,000 EUR, etc.)

Permitted values (Nature) - Name:
- 0 = <Default>
- 1 = Quantity
- 2 = Amount

typeCode.description: Specifies the type of instrument. Instrument types are user-defined classifications of instruments.

typeDenom.description: Specifies the type of instrument. Instrument types are user-defined classifications of instruments.

typeName.description: Specifies the type of instrument. Instrument types are user-defined classifications of instruments.

underlyInstrCode.description: Specifies the underlying instrument of a derivative instrument that has been denormalised into this table.

underlyInstrName.description: Specifies the underlying instrument of a derivative instrument that has been denormalised into this table.

underlyInstrNatureE.description: Specifies the underlying instrument of a derivative instrument that has been denormalised into this table.

usageNatureE.description: To specify usage nature that is applied for the instrument. Instrument usage can be listed, unlisted instrument or OTC instrument template. Default value is listed instrument.

valRuleE.description: Specifies if and how this Financial Instrument is evaluated. If not quoted, the LAST PRICE DATE is null.

wrapEligibleF.description:
This field indicates if the instrument is eligible for wrap services. 

Wrap service is a means of consolidating various fees (administrative expenses, management expenses, commissions for trading, investment advice etc.,) into a single fee for all the services provided. 

An instrument eligible for a wrap service implies that the various fees on that instrument can be wrapped into a single fee.

activeF.description: Describes the state of the Third Party. If a Third Party is inactive, it does not appear on default selection lists.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the third party.
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead.
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

issuerF.description: Indicates that this third party will appear on the issuer selection list.

denom.description: Long name of a market segment. Used for reporting purpose.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the market segment.
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead. At least, if no denominations are available, the name is used.
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

applicationFieldE.description:
For constraints defined on a list of instruments, this field indicates whether the constraint applies to each instrument of the list taken individually or whether the constrains applyy to the sum of the instrument contained in the list.

Please note that this field is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite; it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

calcMaxWeightN.description:
Calculated attribute containing the maximum weight in per cent for the given constraint. If this weight is equal to y, you will have the constraint "<= y %".

Please note that this object is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite; it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

calcMinWeightN.description:
Calculated attribute containing the minimum weight in per cent for the given constraint. If this weight is equal to x, you will have the constraint ">= x %".

Please note that this object is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite; it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

constrBoundCurrId.description:
For constraints in Amount (constr_bound_nat_e = 1) the field indicates the currency in which the amount is expressed.

Please note that this attribute is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite, it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

constrBoundNatE.description:
Indicates the unit value in which min_weight_n and max_weight_n are expressed.

Please note that some bound natures are only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite and have no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

constrNatE.description:
Calculated attribute containing the constraint nature.

Please note that this object is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite; it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

constrTreatE.description:
Indicates how the constraint has to be handled by the derivation process.
Uncovered Out Locking. A mandatory Security Out constraint is defined for a portfolio that does not hold the quantity in the constraint. This exception is not raised if the constraint processing has been set to optional.

creationModeE.description: This attribute is used to define how the modelling constraint (element) was created.

criticalnessE.description:
This attribute determines the constraint's severity.
This attribute is checked regarding the value of system parameters:
1. SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS: 
when the Case Management Component is activated, the constraint's severity could block the Order Session (criticalness' value > system parameter's one).
2. STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS: 
   2.1. for Constraint Breach feature, the attribute's value determines the degree to which a constraint is blocking when a portfolio manager wants to pass orders.
   2.2. using Case Management Component, this value determines what are Cases that must be clarified.

denom.description: That field can be used to enter text information. For example you can describe the meaning of the constraint.

dimInstrDict.description: In the case of an element that is linked to a modelling constraint of nature Security In, Security Out or Trading, it tells whether the constraint element applies to a list of instruments or to a single instrument.

endD.description: Date specifying the end of validity of the modelling constraint element.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the modelling constraint (element).
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead. At least, if no denominations are available, the value is empty (null).
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationDe.description:
Denomination in German.
This is the denomination of the modelling constraint (element) in German. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language German too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationEn.description:
Denomination in English.
This is the denomination of the modelling constraint (element) in English. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language English too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationFr.description:
Denomination in French.
This is the denomination of the modelling constraint (element) in French. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language French too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extSqlCalcD.description:
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

fixedCellF.description:
This field only applies to modelling constraints of nature Allocation.
If it is set to 'yes' it means that the derived weight should be equal to the weight of the asset allocation.

It is important to note that, if this flag is set to 1 (yes), you cannot define minimum or maximum weights.

ignoreMarginF.description: Indicates whether the Fluctuation Margin is ignored or not

instrObject.description: In the case of an element that is linked to a modelling constraint of nature Security In, Security Out or Trading, it gives the list of instruments or the instrument to which the constraint element applies.

instrumentCode.description:
In the case of an element associated to a single instrument that is linked to a modelling constraint of nature Security In, Security Out or Trading, it gives the instrument to which the constraint element is associated.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging to be able to define an association for the Design Studio datasets.

marketSegmentId.description: For Modelling Constraint of nature Allocation: information to which market segment the constraint applies.

maxWeightN.description:
Indicates the maximum bound value for the given constraint. The unit in which this value is expressed is defined by the field constr_bound_nat_e.

If this value is equal to y, you will have the constraint <= y "constr_bound_nat_e".

See also min_weight_n anf fixed_cell_f.

minWeightN.description:
Indicates the minimum bound value for the given constraint. The unit in which this value is expressed is defined by the field constr_bound_nat_e.

If this value is equal to x, you will have the constraint >= x "constr_bound_nat_e".

See also max_weight_n anf fixed_cell_f.

modelConstraintId.description: Refers to the modelling constraint (set) to which the element is attached.

natureE.description: Defines the type of constraint we are dealing with.

priorityN.description:
Defines the priority with which the constraint has to be treated. Smallest values are treated first.

Please note that this field is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite; it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

rightToRunF.description: Technical information used to assess the rights on the script functions like update fields, order grouping etc.

tradingOrderNatE.description:
Indicates the operation natures to which a Trading constraint applies.

Please note that this field only applies to modelling constraints of nature Trading in the context of Odyssey Components Suite; it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

beginD.description: This date tells when the constraint begins to apply.

compositeF.description: Tells if a constraint portfolio should be put out of its composite because of the constraint

criticalnessE.description:
This attribute determines the constraint's severity.
This attribute is checked regarding the value of system parameters:
1. SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS: 
when the Case Management Component is activated, the constraint's severity could block the Order Session (criticalness' value > system parameter's one).
2. STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS: 
   2.1. for Constraint Breach feature, the attribute's value determines the degree to which a constraint is blocking when a portfolio manager wants to pass orders.
   2.2. using Case Management Component, this value determines what are Cases that must be clarified.

dimPortDict.description:
Indicates to which type of object the constraint set applies.

The permitted values, which correspond to entities defined in the 'meta-dictionnary', are:

- Portfolio
- Portfolio List

Please note that the value Portfolio List is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite (release 1.30.6 SP[n] and previous), it has no impact on TripleA Plus release R11 and above.

endD.description: Tells when the constraints stops to be active.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the modelling constraint (set).
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the value is empty (null).
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationDe.description:
Denomination in German.
This is the denomination of the modelling constraint (set) in German. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language German too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationEn.description:
Denomination in English.
This is the denomination of the modelling constraint (set) in English. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language English too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationFr.description:
Denomination in French.
This is the denomination of the modelling constraint (set) in French. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language French too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extSqlCalcD.description:
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

lastConstraintD.description: The last date when the constraint was modified.

natureE.description: Specifies the nature of the modelling constraint. A mandatory hard-coded classifying attribute for distinctive processing.

portObject.description:
Identifier of a Portfolio or a List of Portfolios.

This field contains the ID of an occurrence in the table defined by the 'dim_port_dict_id' field (if not NULL).

Please note that a Portfolio List can only be used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite (release 1.30.6 SP[n] and previous), it has no impact on TripleA Plus release R11 and above.

portfolioCode.description:
In the case of a constraint (set) associated to a single portfolio, it gives the portfolio to which the constraint (set) is associated.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging to be able to define an association for the Design Studio datasets.

portfolioName.description:
In the case of a constraint (set) associated to a single portfolio, it gives the portfolio to which the constraint (set) is associated.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging to be able to define an association for the Design Studio datasets.

rightToRunF.description: Technical information used to assess the rights on the script functions like update fields, order grouping etc.

activeF.description: Specifies whether the portfolio is active or not. This information is used in the Portfolio Selection screen which, by default, only proposes the active portfolios to the user.

adminMgrName.description: Reference to the administrative manager of a portfolio.

commMgrCode.description: Reference to the commercial manager of the portfolio.

commMgrName.description: Reference to the commercial manager of the portfolio.

currencyCode.description: Reference to the currency of the portfolio.

currentWithdreqStatusE.description: This attribute indicates the status of the current withdrawal request for the selected portfolio. It can be used by front-ends to show this information, by automatic rebalancing batches to avoid rebalancing portfolio with pending or failed requests and for defining alerts.

denom.description: Portfolio denomination (not necessarily unique). This field is optional.

extBiCashPercent.description:
Cash Ratio Business Indicator.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is is a business indicator used on the portfolio dashboard. If the cash percentage in the portfolio is greater than a defined threshold, the indicator is set 1.
The threshold is defined by the parameter DS_DBOARD_PTF_CASH_PERCENT.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiCstCompliance.description:
Not Constraints Compliant.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business indicator used on the portfolio dashboard.
No Case Management: Set if the constraints are not compliant.
With Case Management: Set if the constraints are not compliant to a level of needing clarification or of being blocking.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiDaysOperation.description:
Last Operation
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business indicator used on the portfolio dashboard. 
If the number of days since the last operation ext_days_operation is higher than a defined threshold, the value is set to 1.
The threshold is defined with the parameter DS_DBOARD_PTF_DAYS_OPERATION.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiGoalNotCompliant.description:
Indicates if the goal based portfolio is compliant with its objective or not.
Equals to 1 if the goal is a risk, 0 otherwise.

extBiInvalidIp.description:
This attribute defines if the portfolio investment profile is invalid (expired or no profile defined).

This is a business indicator used on the dashboard, set to 1 if the investment profile is invalid.

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extBiIpPndVal.description:
This attribute defines if the investment profile review of the portfolio is pending validation.

This is a business indicator used on the dashboard, set to 1 if the investment profile review is pending validation.

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extBiMktValDrop.description:
Market Value Drop Business Indicator.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business indicator used on the portfolio dashboard. If the market value change defined by ext_change_mkt_val_p has dropped below a defined threshold, the value is set to 1.
The threshold is defined by the parameter DS_DBOARD_PTF_MKT_VAL_DROP.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiObjCompliance.description:
Objectives Not Met.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business indicator used on the portfolio dashboard.
No Case Management: Set if the objectives are not met.
With Case Management: Set if the objectives are not compliant to a level of needing clarification or of being blocking.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiReturn.description:
Return Business Indicator.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business indicator used on the portfolio dashboard. It is, in fact, the same value as ext_ptf_threshold. A new format element has been created to clearly indicate that a dashboard indicator exists for this variable.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extCashPercent.description:
Percentage of Cash
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the percentage of cash, related to the portfolio's current market value, less the advances in cash.
The definition of cash is available in a constrained list on instruments (PCK_DS_CASH), which is set through the parameter DS_QUERY_LIQUIDITY.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extChangeMktValP.description:
Market Value Variation (in %)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the variation, in percentage, between the portfolio's current market value and its market value one year ago, related to the market value one year ago.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extCstCompliance.description:
Constraints Compliance
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

If Case Management is deactivated, the following values are allowed:

- Compliant: Constraints are not breached.
- No Constraints: No constraints are defined on the portfolio.
- Not Compliant  High: Some constraints are breached. 
- Not Evaluated: Impossible to evaluate the constraints.

If Case Management is activated, the following values are allowed:

- Compliant: Constraints are not breached.
- No Constraints: No constraints are defined on the portfolio.
- Not Compliant  High: Some breached constraints are based on severities which are high (associated severity >= system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Low: Some breached constraints are based only on severities which are low (associated severities < system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Medium: Some breached constraints are based on severities which are medium (system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS <= associated severities < system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Evaluated: Impossible to evaluate the constraints.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDateOperation.description:
Last Operation Date
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
It indicates the date of the last operation performed on the portfolio.
The operation can be a buy, a sell, an investment, a withdrawal, a transfer, or a portfolio transfer. Its status must be greater or equal to Order and the nature of the instrument can be a stock, a fixed income, an option, a future, a discount instrument, a fund share, an option bond, a convertible bond, or an exotic option.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDaysOperation.description:
Last Operation (in days)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
It idicates the number of days between the current date and the last operation performed on the portfolio.
The operation can be a buy, a sell, an investment, a withdrawal, a transfer, or a portfolio transfer. Its status must be greater or equal to Order and the nature of the instrument can be a stock, a fixed income, an option, a future, a discount instrument, a fund share, an option bond, a convertible bond, or an exotic option.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the portfolio.
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead. At least, if no denominations are available, the name is used.
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extGoalComplianceStatusE.description:
This attribute defines the compliance status of a goal based portfolio and can have the following permitted values:
0  None 
1  On track, the goal based portfolio is on track based on its objective and time horizon. 
2  At risk, the goal based portfolio is at risk and may not achieve its objective in the defined time horizon.
3  Completed, the goal based portfolio is completed.

extInvestProfileId.description:
This attribute indicates the investment profile currently linked to the portfolio via a strategy link. If no investment profile is currently linked to the portfolio then this attribute's value will be empty.
This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extIpCurStatus.description:
This attribute defines the status of the current portfolio investment profile and can have the following permitted values:

0  None
1  No profile, no investment profile defined yet
2  Valid, the current investment profile is valid. Expiry date not reached
3  Expired, the current investment profile is expired.

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extIpExpiryD.description:
This attributes defines the expiry date of the current investment profile.

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extIpName.description:
Investment Profile Name
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the name of the investment profile containing the head strategy used for rebalancing. If no investment profiles are used for the link between the portfolio and the head strategy, then the extended attribute's value is empty.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extIpRiskLevelN.description:
Indicates the investment profile risk level; the risk level of the investment profile that contains the head strategy used for rebalancing. If no investment profiles are used for the link between the portfolio and the head strategy, then the extended attribute's value is empty. (See also ext_ip_name.)

This is an extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation (for more information, refer to the Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

This attribute is used only for the Web packaging.

extIpRvwStatus.description:
This attribute defines the status of the current review of the portfolio investment profile and can have the following permitted values:

0  None, no review in progress
1  In progress, review in progress
2  Pending approval, review pending validation

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extObjCompliance.description:
Objectives Compliance
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
If Case Management is deactivated, the following values are allowed:

- Compliant: Actual weights are compliant compared to their objectives with margins.
- No Objectives: No objectives are defined on the investment structure.
- Not Compliant  High: Some actual weights are not compliant with their objectives with margins.
- Not Evaluated: Impossible to evaluate the objectives' compliance

If Case Management is activated, the following values are allowed:

- Compliant: Actual weights are compliant compared to their objectives with margins.
- No Objectives: No objectives are defined on the investment structure.
- Not Compliant  High: Some non-compliant actual weights are based on severities which are high (associated severity >= system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Low: Some non-compliant actual weights are based only on severities which are low (associated severities < system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Medium: Some non-compliant actual weights are based on severities which are medium (system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS <= associated severities < system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Evaluated: Impossible to evaluate the objectives' compliance.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extObjMeanDiff.description:
Strategy Deviation (in %)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
It indicates the medium values of all differences between the actual weight and the objective's weight with its margins of all investment structure elements (positions and market segments).
A complete explanation of the computation can be found in section Strategy Deviation Computation of the Triple'A Plus Web Packaging Reference Guide

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extOneYearPtfRet.description:
Portfolio return over the last 12 months

This is the return of the portfolio over the last 12 months (with adaptation to month end).

It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the end-user but filled by batch pre-computation overnight (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extOpenOrders.description:
Indicates whether orders are pending on the market for this portfolio. Orders are considered to be pending in the market if their status is between (including) the values as defined in the system parameters SYS_OPSTATUS_SENT and SYS_OPSTATUS_EXECUTED.

This is an extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation (for more information, refer to the Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extOverUnderPerf.description:
Ptf/Bench Over/Under Performance
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the difference between the portfolio's return and its benchmark's return, if benchmark's return is available.


This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extPlPercent.description:
Portfolio P&L (in %)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the difference between the market value and the cost value of the portfolio, expressed in percentage of cost value.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extPtfCur.description:
Portfolio Ccy.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the ISO code of the portfolio's currency, which is a synonym's value. If it is not available, the portfolio's currency's code is returned instead.
The definition of the synonym's code to be used is set through the parameter DS_CURRENCY_CODE (which is delivered with no values).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extPtfHierLevel.description:
This is an extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation (refer to the Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide). It defines the hierarchy level of the portfolio.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

Possible values are:
0 - Parent and not child
1 - Parent and child
2 - Not parent, but child
3 - Not parent and not child

extRedemEndD.description:
Indicates the end date of the first next instrument for redemption in Fixed Income nature.

An extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation (refer to the Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide for more information).

This attribute is used only for the Web packaging.

extRedemEndD2.description:
Indicates the end date of the first next instrument for redemption in Derivative nature.

An extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation (refer to the Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide for more information).

This attribute is used only for the Web packaging.

extRedemEndD3.description:
Indicates the end date of the first next instrument for redemption in Money Market nature.

An extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation (refer to the Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide for more information).

This attribute is used only for the Web packaging.

extRedemEndD4.description:
Indicates the end date of the first next instrument for redemption in Forwards nature.

An extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation (refer to the Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide for more information).

This attribute is used only for the Web packaging.

extRefCur.description:
System Ccy.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the ISO code of the system currency which is a synonym's value. If it is not available, the system currency's code is returned instead.
The definition of the synonym's code to be used is set through the parameter DS_CURRENCY_CODE (which is delivered with no values).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extTdMktValM.description:
Market Value (Sys. Ccy.)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the current market value of the portfolio in system currency.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extYtdPtfReturn.description:
Portfolio year-to-date return

This is the return of the portfolio since the beginning of the year up to the current day.

It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the end-user but filled by batch pre-computation overnight (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

languageCode.description: Unique identifier of a language. The possible values are set by OAMS and cannot be modified.

lastRebalancingD.description: Defines the last date the portfolio was rebalanced.

lastRebalancingStatusE.description: This attribute indicates the status of the last rebalancing performed on the portfolio. It can contain either the last automatic rebalancing (batch) or manual process. However, for manual processes, only rebalancing performed with the publishing option is automatically handled. Otherwise, each front-end has the responsability to make this attribute up-to-date.

mgtBeginD.description: Management begin date (for information purposes only).

name.description: Portfolio name (not necessarily unique). This field is mandatory.

parentPortId.description: Reference to the parent portfolio. This reference makes it possible to define a hierarchy of portfolios. To include a hierarchy when you use the financial functions, select the No Hierarchy checkbox on the Domain screen's Parameters tab. The checkbox label changes to Load Hierarchy, indicating that the hierarchy, if there is one, will be loaded.

serviceTypeE.description:
This field is used to specify the portfolio service type, meaning the manner a portfolio is managed by the bank (which services are provided).

This data is used in front-ends including in each input control applied in a context of a Suitability and Appropriateness tests.

statusE.description: Defines the status of the portfolio.

taxLotMngtE.description:
Specifies if tax lot are managed on the portfolio.
Not yet implemented.

thirdCode.description: Reference to a third party customer who is the owner of the portfolio.

thirdName.description: Reference to a third party customer who is the owner of the portfolio.

typeDenom.description: Reference to the type of the portfolio.

beginD.description: Begin date of the link between an Object and a Strategy.

endD.description:
End Date of the link between an object and a strategy.
No NULL value can be inserted in this field. A NULL value, which means no end to the link between a strategy and an object, must be replaced by a date somewhen in the future.

portfolioCode.description:
In the case of a strategy link related to a single portfolio, it gives the portfolio to which the strategy link is related.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging to be able to define an association for the Design Studio datasets.

strategyCode.description: Technical identifier for a strategy. This field is usually not seen by the user.

strategyNatureE.description: Technical identifier for a strategy. This field is usually not seen by the user.
enum: Instr. Res. % of Strat Mkt Sgt

linkNatE.description: This nature allows to specify which kind of link relates a strategy to an object.

minBuyAmountN.description: Please note that this object is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite, it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

minBuyPercentageP.description: Please note that this object is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite, it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

minSellAmountN.description: Please note that this object is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite, it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

minSellPercentageP.description: Please note that this object is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite, it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations.

object.description: Indicates the occurrence of the corresponding object type that belongs to the composition of the "Benchmark" or "Investment Profile".

priorityN.description:
Indicates the relative inportance of a strategy for a portfolio or list of portfolios.
"1" is the most important. <NULL> are processed at least importance.

strategyHistoryId.description: Reference of an occurrence in 'Strategy History' to which a 'Strategy Composition' necessarily belongs.

weightN.description:
This attribute allows defining the percentage of the strategy defined in the composition of a strategy with "Composite" nature. This is used when we want to define a Core-Satellite strategy structure.

Please note that this object is only used in the context of Odyssey Components Suite, it has no impact on TripleA Financial Server computations

weightNatureE.description: Describes how the Weight is computed.

actTrackErrN.description:
Current's value of Tracking Error.
The Tracking Error measures the unexplained portion of an investments performance relative to a benchmark. It is the standard deviation of the difference between the portfolio and the benchmark return.

benchAnalysisObject.description:
Reference to an object (which entity depends on the value of the attribute bench_analysis_entity_id) which could be used to define a second type of benchmark for a particular strategy. 

Note that in the benchmark storage function, we test whether the user decided to use this new type of benchmark to build up his strategy. We assume that if at least one bench_analysis_object_id is not NULL, the strategy benchmark will take reference on this attribute.

benchDimensionE.description:
This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

Dimension of benchmark related to the strategy's objective. This attribute is directly related to the attribute [bench_entity_dict_id]

benchObject.description:
Indicates, when a strategy duplicates an benchmark, the occurrence of the corresponding object type which is duplicated.
This benchmarking is valid only for strategy nature such as 'allocation', 'model portfolio'.

complianceChronoCompNatE.description: Indicates the type of Compliance Chrono nature.

constraintTemplateCode.description:
This field corresponds to a template to enter new constraints in the system throughout the constraint wizard tool.

This tool allows end-users to define constraint sets and trading constraints directly in the system.

The constraint wizard main principle is to provide users with a set of pre-defined explicit constraint templates. After having selected a template, users give the required parameters (i.e. value, date etc.). When they confirm their input, the system generates automatically the corresponding script definition. Afterwards users can modify the constraint parameters. The system overrides automatically the previous definition.

constraintTemplateDenom.description:
This field corresponds to a template to enter new constraints in the system throughout the constraint wizard tool.

This tool allows end-users to define constraint sets and trading constraints directly in the system.

The constraint wizard main principle is to provide users with a set of pre-defined explicit constraint templates. After having selected a template, users give the required parameters (i.e. value, date etc.). When they confirm their input, the system generates automatically the corresponding script definition. Afterwards users can modify the constraint parameters. The system overrides automatically the previous definition.

constraintTemplateId.description:
This field corresponds to a template to enter new constraints in the system throughout the constraint wizard tool.

This tool allows end-users to define constraint sets and trading constraints directly in the system.

The constraint wizard main principle is to provide users with a set of pre-defined explicit constraint templates. After having selected a template, users give the required parameters (i.e. value, date etc.). When they confirm their input, the system generates automatically the corresponding script definition.
