Afterwards users can modify the constraint parameters. The system overrides automatically the previous definition.

criticalnessE.description:
This attribute returns the severity set at Strategy & Constraint level.

Activating the Case Management Component, the severity is checked regarding the value of system parameters:
1. SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS: 
the case's severity could block the Order Session (criticalness' value > system parameter's one).
2. STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS: 
the case's severity determines what are Cases that must be clarified.

Using the Constraint Breach facility, this attribute determines the level to which a constraint is blocking when passing an Order into an Order Session (Order Entry, Allocate Order and Strategy Reconciliation).

See Orders & Productivity Guide.

denom.description: Description of the strategy element. Useful for "unstructured constraint" strategy element.

effTrackErrN.description:
Effective's Value of Tracking Error.
The Tracking Error measures the unexplained portion of an investments performance relative to a benchmark. It is the standard deviation of the difference between the portfolio and the benchmark return.

fluctMarginN.description: In case of an objective which is described in tem of a reference to an other object, an additive (positive or negative) margin can be applied to it.

instrCode.description:
Reference to a financial instrument.
Used only for 'strategy element' beeing part of a 'model portfolio' or a 'recommendation list'  strategy.

instrId.description:
Reference to a financial instrument.
Used only for 'strategy element' beeing part of a 'model portfolio' or a 'recommendation list'  strategy.

limitNatE.description:
Defines thetype of limit for the strategy objective. This information is significant only in the case of an 'allocation constraint' strategy.

The value of the limit is stored in the 'value_n' filed. 
For instance, if the objective is 20% (Nature = Percentage) invested in the Swiss stock market (market segment). the lower limit could be 3%.
To interpret this figure, the nature of the objective has also to be taken into account.

marketSegmentId.description:
Used only to be associated to a 'strategy element' belonging to an 'allocation' or an 'allocation constraint set'.
It contains a market segment identifier of the 'grid' associated to the strategy.

maxN.description:
Maximum Value (of an Objective).
Used for Risk Strategy.

minN.description:
Minimum Value (of an Objective).
Used for Risk Strategy.

natureE.description: A mandatory "hard-coded" classifying attribute for distinctive processing.

objTrackErrMarginN.description:
Objective's Margin linked to the Tracking Error.
The Tracking Error measures the unexplained portion of an investments performance relative to a benchmark. It is the standard deviation of the difference between the portfolio and the benchmark return.

objTrackErrN.description:
Objective linked to the Tracking Error.
The Tracking Error measures the unexplained portion of an investments performance relative to a benchmark. It is the standard deviation of the difference between the portfolio and the benchmark return.

objTrackErrorCheckE.description:
Indicates if the Objective's Tracking Error is checked or not.
The Tracking Error measures the unexplained portion of an investments performance relative to a benchmark. It is the standard deviation of the difference between the portfolio and the benchmark return.

Permitted values are:

0: not checked
1: checked

priorityN.description:
The instrument or market segment priorities are used to define, in the case of purchases, the order the instruments are processed for buys. Two or more instruments having the same priorities shall be purchased as to correct the highest deficits first, as currently done.
In the case of recommendation lists, under the MARKET_SEGMENT_RANK system parameter set, the priority_n shall play the role of the rank_n, relegated in this context to a display role only.

rankN.description: The rank is part of the logical indentifier of the strategy element. It will be used for display purposes.

recomNatE.description: This information is useful for 'model portfolio' or 'recommendation list'.

strategyHistoryId.description: Reference of an occurrence in 'strategy history' to which a 'strategy element' necessarily belongs to.

valueN.description:
Defines the value of  the strategy objective.
For instance, the objective could be 20% (Nature = Percentage)  invested in the Swiss stock market (market segment), or a Beta of 1 (Nature = Beta) for the overall portfolio.

applicD.description:
Strategy application date: it allows to distinguish the validity date from the application date.
In R3.50, just for information purpose.

beginD.description:
Begin Date of a 'Strategy History'. This date is part of the 'Strategy History' primary key.
This information is combined with the 'End Date' to check that, for the same 'Strategy', there is no overlapping of occurrences in 'Strategy History'.

denom.description:
Long name of the occurrence. Used mainly for reporting 
purposes (see the 'Denomination' table).

endD.description:
End date of a 'Strategy History'.
This parameter is optional. No end date provided means no end to the link between a strategy and an object.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the strategy history.
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead. At least, if no denominations are available, the value is empty (null).
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationDe.description:
Denomination in German.
This is the denomination of the strategy history in German. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language German too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationEn.description:
Denomination in English.
This is the denomination of the strategy history in English. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language English too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationFr.description:
Denomination in French.
This is the denomination of the strategy history in French. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language French too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extSqlCalcD.description:
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

strategyCode.description: Reference of the strategy to which a strategy history necessarily belongs to.

enum: Instr. Res. % of Strat Mkt Sgt

benchFreqN.description: Number of unit of bench_freq_unit_e. See this attribute for more information.

benchFreqUnitE.description:
Used in conjunction with bench_freq_n, it indicates the "logical" rebalancing frequency, strating on the strat_rebal_d. This information is used during the Benchmark Storage process: if the frequency of rebalancing AND the strat_rebal_d are not void, the strategy will be rebalanced at regular dates, ie. the current physical weights are stored instead of the dynamic weight.

Example : Benchmark Storage, on a monthly basis, starting on 31/12/01, ending on 31/03/02, with a strat_rebal_d=18/11/00 and logical frequency of 1 month, the storage will be done on the following dates :

1. 31/12/01 - 18/01/02
2. 18/01/02 - 31/01/02
3. 31/01/02 - 18/02/02
4. 18/02/02 - 28/02/02
5. 28/02/02 - 18/03/02
6. 18/03/02 - 31/03/02

benchObject.description:
Indicates, when a strategy duplicates an benchmark, the occurrence of the corresponding object type which is duplicated.
This benchmarking is valid only for strategy natures such as 'allocation' or 'model portfolio'.

complianceFreqN.description:
Defines the Risk Strategy required frequency update.
The compliance frequency unit is defined by day, week, month, quarter, semester, year.

complianceFreqUnitE.description: The compliance frequency is defined as number of frequency unit.

criticalnessE.description:
This attribute determines the constraint's severity.
This attribute is checked regarding the value of system parameters:
1. SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS: 
when the Case Management Component is activated, the constraint's severity could block the Order Session (criticalness' value > system parameter's one).
2. STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS: 
using Case Management Component, this value determines what are Cases that must be clarified.

Used for Asset Allocation, Model Portfolio and Constraint Set.

denom.description: Long Name for a strategy.

dimGridDict.description: It allows you to assign a grid or a grid list to a strategy.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the strategy.
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead. At least, if no denominations are available, the name is used.
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationDe.description:
Denomination in German.
This is the denomination of the strategy in German. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language German too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationEn.description:
Denomination in English.
This is the denomination of the strategy in English. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language English too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDenominationFr.description:
Denomination in French.
This is the denomination of the strategy in French. It is automatically generated as the extended attribute "ext_denomination" is defined as multilanguage and the language French too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extSqlCalcD.description:
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

fluctMarginN.description: Allows to specify for a model portfolio the global fluctuation margin that is applied to each financial instrument composing the model portfolio when  compared to the real portfolio.

gridObject.description:
Allows users to assign a grid list or a grid to a strategy.
Moreover, the user can assign a grid/grid list to model portfolios or recommendation lists. 
Please refer to the Triple'A Orders and Productivity Guide for more details on this feature.

heartUploadE.description: Only used if you implement the Triple'A - HEART interface. This attribute tells whether or not the strategy is uploaded in HEART.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

invProfRiskLevelN.description: This field stores the level of the risk that the Investment Profile can take.

irregularF.description: Benchmark Storage process definition flag. It indicates for a storage period whether only the current - at from date - strategy history weights are used for computation or any new strategy history weights found between the from date and the till date are taken into account.

lastComplianceUpdateD.description: Defines the last date on which the Risk Strategy has been updated.

lastStoredBenchD.description: A non-editable date at which the instrument has been stored the last time. Update by the Benchmark Storage function process.

lastUpdateD.description: Date of the last update of the strategy. For information only.

marketSegmentId.description:
Reference to a 'market segment'.
A 'model portfolio' or a 'recommendation list' strategy may be restricted to a particular 'market segment'.

natureE.description:
Indicates the 'nature' of the 'strategy'. 
For more information please see the Orders and Productivity Guide, and the Performance Analysis Reference Guide.
enum: Instr. Res. % of Strat Mkt Sgt

parentStrategyId.description:
Technical identifier for a strategy. This field is normally not seen by the user.
This relation allows to indicates that a strategy is a 'sub-strategy' of a strategy of a higher level.
For instance, an asset allocation may have one model per market segment as sub-strategy.

relativeMarginF.description:
It defines how Margins are computed.

Example:
Consider an Investment Profile (Asset Allocation, with an objective weight = 10% on Chemicals, and a Model Portfolio with two Instruments, 50% Novartis & 50% Roche). 
The Fluctuation Margin is defined as equal as 1% into Model Portfolio.

Stock
  Stock/CHF
    Chemicals                  Objve: 10%
       Novartis                        5%
       Roche                           5%

The computation of Fluctuation Margin is as follows:
Absolute: 1% * 10% = +/- 0.10%
Relative: 1% * 5% = +/- 0.05%
Unweighted Absolute: +/- 1%.

retDetLevE.description:
Benchmark Storage detail level:
1. Global
2. Grid
3. Instrument

rightToRunF.description: Technical information used to assess the rights on the script functions like update fields, order grouping etc.

riskF.description:
Indicates whether a strategy is defined in term of risks exposure or not.
This information is used when comparing a portfolio to a strategy. If the flag is 'Yes', the 'risk exposure' valuation of the portfolio will be taken into account in the comparison process.

stratRebalD.description: Benchmark Storage process definition date. Used in conjunction with bench_freq_n and bench_freq_unit_e. See this latter attribute for more information.

barrierN.description: Used in Barrier option to indicate the barrier. In double barriers, it indicates the lower barrier.

beginD.description:
Specifies the date from which the exercise may occur.

For events that can occur only at one specific date (e.g., European options, futures, etc.), it will be equal to END_DATE.

Integrity rules:
- Must be less than or equal the end_date.
- Used in Asian options as the first date on which the averaging takes place. (The Asian current average is stored in the option instrument chrono.)

currencyCode.description: Unique technical identifier of the occurrence.

endD.description:
Specifies the last date on which an event may occur.

Integrity rule:
- If specified, it must be greater than or equal the Begin_Date (see Begin_Date definition).

exerQuoteN.description:
Specifies the market quotation at which the underlying is exchanged.

Notes:
- If the underlying instrument is a currency, the quote stored here is the exchange rate as quoted by the market. However, the price stored must satisfy the quantity * price equation. (Price may be = 1/Quote.) 
- The currency of the quote is expressed through its relationship with Currency.
- Delivery quotes for non-repetitive Futures and Forwards are found in the position.

exerQuoteP.description:
Identifies the exercise quote (strike) in percentage of initial fixing price applicable to the underlying instrument when the redemption quote is applicable to the instrument. It is used for exotic options that embed terms and conditions relative to an underlying with a strike. 

Applicable for exotic options definition management.

leverageN.description:
Specifies the multiplier factor applied to the quantity of the underlying for structured product (e.g., Mini Future-Turbo or Accumulator).

Applicable for structured product definition management and is stored for information purposes only.

lowerBarrierP.description:
This attribute is used to capture the Lower barrier price expressed as a % of Exercise Price when applicable. 

Applicable for exotic option definition management.

optStyleE.description:
Indicates when the option can be exercised.
- American options can be exercised at all times.
- European options can be exercised at expiration date.

Permitted values:
- 0 = None
- 1 = American 
- 2 = European
- 3 = Bermudan

Integrity rules:
- The value 0 is applicable to instruments with Futures or Forwards nature.
- The values 1, 2, and 3 are applicable to instruments with Option nature.

optionClassE.description:
Describes whether the holder has the right to buy or sell the underlying.
When not defined, the event is firm.

Permitted values:
- 0 = Not optional
- 1 = Call
- 2 = Put

Integrity rules:
- The 0 value applies to instruments with a Forward or Future nature.
- The 1 and 2 values apply to instruments with an Option nature.

protectedD.description:
For structured products, it defines the date that guarantees a minimum period before which the knock-out conditions are not applicable (disabled).

Applicable for structured product definition management and is stored for information purposes only.

underlyFixingPriceN.description:
This attribute is used in the case of an exotic option to capture the initial price for the underlying instrument, which is used to define exercise and barrier levels when applicable. 

Applicable for exotic option definition management.

underlyInstrCode.description:
Indicates the instrument upon which the term contract is derived.

For bond futures, the term contract is deemed to be on a notional bond but all calculations are done on the cheapest-to-deliver bond. Therefore, the underlying is deemed to be a composite instrument (so that conversion ratios can be described) that contains the cheapest-to-deliver. 

Note: The cheapest-to-deliver can either be specified or calculated by the system.

underlyInstrDenom.description:
Indicates the instrument upon which the term contract is derived.

For bond futures, the term contract is deemed to be on a notional bond but all calculations are done on the cheapest-to-deliver bond. Therefore, the underlying is deemed to be a composite instrument (so that conversion ratios can be described) that contains the cheapest-to-deliver. 

Note: The cheapest-to-deliver can either be specified or calculated by the system.

underlyQtyN.description:
Specifies the number of underlying instruments that can be obtained by exercising this contract.

Integrity rule:
- Must be strictly greater than 0.

upperBarrierN.description: In double barrier options, indicates the upper barrier.

upperBarrierP.description:
This attribute is used to capture the Upper barrier price expressed as a % of Exercise Price when applicable. 

Applicable for exotic option definition management.

validityD.description: Indicates the date from which the condition is valid.

activeF.description: Describes the state of the Third Party. If a Third Party is inactive, it does not appear on default selection lists.

beginD.description: It is the date when the third party is foreseen as active

bestExecE.description: This field indicates whether the Best Execution Policy is signed or not.

cliClassifE.description:
Manages the client's categorisation. By default, it is set to None. 

This field may be modified by authorised users if a professional client requests to be treated as a retail client for the Mifid compliance.

clientF.description: Indicates that this third party will appear on the client selection list.

commodDerivKnowE.description: This approach provides more precisely which complex instruments the client knows. Therefore several fields are needed in order to specify which categories of complex instruments the client knows. This one is used for commodities derivatives.

complexInstrKnowF.description: This flag is used to specify whether the client knows complex instruments.

creditDerivKnowE.description: This approach provides more precisely which complex instruments the client knows. Therefore several fields are needed in order to specify which categories of complex instruments the client knows. This one is used for credit derivatives.

currDerivKnowE.description: This approach provides more precisely which complex instruments the client knows. Therefore several fields are needed in order to specify which categories of complex instruments the client knows. This one is used for currency derivatives.

currencyCode.description:
Mandatory reference currency of the third party.
Is used when consolidation at the client level are requested.

denom.description: Long name of the occurrence. Multi-lingual denominations are found in the denomination table.

eMailAddressC.description: E-mail address of the third party.

economicStatKnowE.description: This approach provides more precisely which complex instruments the client knows. Therefore several fields are needed in order to specify which categories of complex instruments the client knows. This one is used for economic statistics.

educationLevelE.description: This field is used to specify the level of education of the client. This could be one argument used to check if the client has the right level of knowledge in complex instruments.

extBiCashPercent.description:
Cash Ratio.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business indicator used on the client dashboard.
Set to 1 if the cash ratio business indicator for any of the client's portfolios is set to 1.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiCategory.description:
The client category.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a field used for the client dashboard. It contains the client type.
This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiCstCompliance.description:
Constraints compliant.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business indicator used on the client dashboard.
Set to 1 if the constraints business indicator for any of the client's portfolios is set to 1.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiDaysOperation.description:
Days since last operation.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business indicator used on the client dashboard.
Set to 1 if the days since last operation business indicator fpr any of the client's portfolios is set to 1.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiDaysProposal.description:
Days since last proposal.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business indicator used on the client dashboard.
Set to 1 if the number of days since the last proposal is larger than a defined threshold. The threshold is defined using parameter DS_DBOARD_CLIENT_DAYS_PROPOSAL.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiInvalidMifid.description:
This attribute defines if the MiFID profile of the client is invalid (expired or no profile defined).

This is a business indicator used on the dashboard, set to 1 if the MiFID profile is invalid.

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extBiMifidPndVal.description:
This attribute defines if the MiFID profile review of the client is pending validation.

This is a business indicator used on the dashboard, set to 1 if the MiFID profile review is pending validation.

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extBiMktValDrop.description:
Market Value Drop.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business indicator used on the client dashboard.
Set to 1 if the market value drop business indicator for any of client's portfolios is set to 1.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiObjCompliance.description:
Objectives met.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is a business inidcator used on the client dashboard.
Set to 1 if the objectives met business indicator for any of the client's portfolios is set to 1.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extBiProposalPending.description:
If there are proposals, which are in status "Sent for Validation", for the client's proposals, and the number of days between the last modifiction date for the oldest of these proposals, and the current date exceeds the value of the system paramter DS_DBOARD_CLIENT_PENDING_PROP, the value is set to 1.

This attribute can then be evaluated for the definition of pre-defined queries and alerts.  


It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
Indicates whether at least one of the portfolios related to the client has an advisory service.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extCashPercent.description:
Cash Ratio.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
The largest cash percentage of all the portfolios linked to the client.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extChangeMktValP.description:
Market Value Drop.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
The largest drop in market value (expressed in %) of all the portfolios linked to the client.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extCstCompliance.description:
Constraints Compliance
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

If Case Management is deactivated, the following values are allowed:

- Compliant: Constraints are not breached.
- No Constraints: No constraints are defined on the associated portfolios.
- Not Compliant  High: Some constraints are breached. 
- Not Evaluated: Impossible to evaluate the constraints.

If Case Management is activated, the following values are allowed:

- Compliant: Constraints are not breached.
- No Constraints: No constraints are defined on the associated portfolios.
- Not Compliant  High: Some breached constraints are based on severities which are high (associated severity >= system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Low: Some breached constraints are based only on severities which are low (associated severities < system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Medium: Some breached constraints are based on severities which are medium (system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS <= associated severities < system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDateOperation.description:
Last Operation Date
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
Indicates the date of the last operation performed on all portfolios related to the client.
It is the most recent date of all Last Operation Date (extended attribute) on client portfolios.
The operation can be a buy, a sell, an investment, a withdrawal, a transfer, or a portfolio transfer. Its status must be greater or equal to Order and the nature of the Instrument can be a stock, a fixed income, an option, a future, a discount instrument, a fund share, an option bond, a convertible bond, or an exotic option.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDateProposal.description:
Last Proposal Date
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
Indicates the date of the last proposal performed on all portfolios related to the client.
A proposal is an order session (function result), related to a portfolio, whose session nature is equal to Investment Proposal and whose session status is equal to Sent to Client or Accepted

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDaysOperation.description:
Last Operation (in days)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
Indicates the number of days between the current date and the last operation performed on all portfolios related to the client.
It is the minimum value of all Last Operation (in days) (extended attribute) on client portfolios.
The operation can be a buy, a sell, an investment, a withdrawal, a transfer, or a portfolio transfer. Its status must be greater or equal to Order and the nature of the instrument can be a stock, a fixed income, an option, a future, a discount instrument, a fund share, an option bond, a convertible bond, or an exotic option.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extDaysProposal.description:
Last Proposal (in days)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
Indicates the number of days between the current date and the last proposal performed on all portfolios related to the client.
A proposal is an order session (function result), related to a portfolio, whose session nature is equal to Investment Proposal and whose session status is equal to Sent to Client or Accepted

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extMifidCurStatus.description:
This attribute defines the status of the current MiFID profile of the client and can have the following permitted values:

0  None
1  No profile, no MiFID profile defined yet
2  Valid, the current MiFID profile is valid. Expiry date not reached
3  Expired, the current MiFID profile is expired.

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extMifidExpiryD.description:
This attributes defines the expiry date of the current MiFID profile.

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extMifidRvwStatus.description:
This attribute defines the status of the current review of the MiFID profile of the client and can have the following permitted values:

0  None, no review in progress
1  In progress, review in progress
2  Pending approval, review pending validation

This attribute is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

extObjCompliance.description:
Objectives Compliance
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).

If Case Management is deactivated, the following values are allowed:

- Compliant: Actual weights are compliant compared to their objectives with margins.
- No Objectives: No objectives are defined on the investment structure.
- Not Compliant  High: Some actual weights are not compliant with their objectives with margins.
- Not Evaluated: Impossible to evaluate the objectives' compliance.

If Case Management is activated, the following values are allowed:

- Compliant: Actual weights are compliant compared to their objectives with margins.
- No Objectives: No objectives are defined on the investment structure.
- Not Compliant  High: Some non-compliant actual weights are based on severities which are high (associated severity >= system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Low: Some non-compliant actual weights are based only on severities which are low (associated severities < system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Medium: Some non- compliant actual weights are based on severities which are medium (system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS <= associated severities < system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Evaluated:It was impossible to evaluate the objectives' compliance.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extRefCur.description:
System Ccy.
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the ISO code of the system currency, which is a synonym's value. If it is not available, the system currency's code is returned instead.
The definition of the synonym's code to be used is set through the parameter DS_CURRENCY_CODE (which is delivered with no values).

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

extRiskCompliance.description:
Risk Compliance is an extended attribute that cannot be edited by the user but requires a data pre-computation. In the standard packaging, this attribute is built from the results of the worst risk indicators of VaR %, Volatility %, Tracking Error %, Expected Shortfall %, Diversification Effect %, VaR amount, Expected Shortfall amount, Diversification Effect amount, Risk Grade, Volatility amount, Tracking Error amount, Shortfall Probability %, and Shortfall Probability amount.

For each indicator, the compliance is calculated as follows:

If Case Management is deactivated, the following values are allowed:
- Risk Compliant: Risk values are under risk objectives.
- No Risk Objectives: No risk objectives are defined in the portfolio.
- Not Risk Compliant: Some risk objectives are reached. 
- Not Evaluated: No risk values calculated.


If Case Management is activated, the following values are allowed:
- Risk Compliant: Risk values are under risk objectives.
- No Risk Objectives: No risk objectives are defined in the portfolio.
- Not Compliant  High: Some risk objectives are reached and are based on severities     that are high (associated severity >= system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Medium: Some risk objectives are reached and are based on severities that are medium (system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS <= associated severities < system parameter SESSION_BLOCK_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Compliant  Low: Some risk objectives are reached and are based on severities that are low (associated severities < system parameter STRAT_BLOCKCONSTR_CRITICALNESS).
- Not Evaluated: No risk values calculated.

This attribute is used only for the web packaging.

extTdMktValM.description:
Market Value (Sys. Ccy.)
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the current market value of the client in system currency. It is the total market value, in system currency, of all portfolios related to the client.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

faxC.description: The fax number of the third party.

gdprChildF.description:
Considered as child for General Data Protection Regulation.

This attribute is only used in the context of the WM integration.

gdprInscopeF.description:
In scope for General Data Protection Regulation.

This attribute is only used in the context of the WM integration.

gdprProcessRestrictionF.description:
In scope for General Data Protection Regulation.

This attribute is only used in the context of the WM integration.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

indiceDerivKnowE.description: This approach provides more precisely which complex instruments the client knows. Therefore several fields are needed in order to specify which categories of complex instruments the client knows. This one is used for index derivatives.

intDerivKnowE.description: This approach provides more precisely which complex instruments the client knows. Therefore several fields are needed in order to specify which categories of complex instruments the client knows. This one is used for interest rate derivatives.

languageCode.description: Unique identifier of a language. These values are fixed by OAMS and  cannot be modified.

lastContactD.description:
Date of last contact

legalEntityStatusE.description: Corresponds to the Wealth Suite Front Office CRM (WM) legal entity status. Used in the context of data integration of legal entities from Wealth Suite Front Office CRM (WM) into third parties in Wealth Suite Front Office PM (TAP). This enumerated field can be extended by adding new permitted values (no overwrite of the standard ones).

legalEntityTypeE.description: Corresponds to the Wealth Suite Front Office CRM (WM) legal entity type. Used in the context of data integration of legal entities from Wealth Suite Front Office CRM (WM) into third parties in Wealth Suite Front Office PM (TAP). This enumerated field cannot be extended.

managerCode.description:
Manager, who is in charge of the client relationship. 
This attribute is for information purpose only.

managerName.description:
Manager, who is in charge of the client relationship. 
This attribute is for information purpose only.

mifidLastModifD.description: This field is used to persist the date when the client data have been last modified.

nextContactD.description:
Planned date for next contact

This attribute is only used in the context of the WM integration.

otherComplexKnowE.description: This approach provides more precisely which complex instruments the client knows. Therefore several fields are needed in order to specify which categories of complex instruments the client knows. This one is used for other complex instruments.

phoneC.description: The telephone number of the third party.

residGeoCode.description: Legal residence of the third party.

residGeoExtDenomination.description: Legal residence of the third party.

riskGeoCode.description:
Risk country of the third party. 
In particular, for custodians, counterparties, security issuers.

riskGeoExtDenomination.description:
Risk country of the third party. 
In particular, for custodians, counterparties, security issuers.

secDerivKnowE.description: This approach provides more precisely which complex instruments the client knows. Therefore several fields are needed in order to specify which categories of complex instruments the client knows. This one is used for securities.

statusE.description: Defines the status of a third party.

taxGeoCode.description: Fiscal residence of the third party.

taxGeoExtDenomination.description: Fiscal residence of the third party.

telexC.description: The mask number of the third party.

dataSecuProfCode.description:
Reference to a data security profile associated to an occurrence.
This field, which is mandatory, is used to control the user access to one occurrence.

denom.description:
The 'long' name which will be used as default name (in 
relationship with ...DENOMINATION....LANGUAGE).

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the list
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead. At least, if no denominations are available, the name is used.
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

name.description: Short name of an occurrence. This short name has not to be unique.

natureE.description: Defines the nature of a list in the application. These nature implies different type of processing within the application, see description of each permitted value.

queryDefinition.description:
This attribute is only used for the Web packaging.
This Field contains the query definition used by the dynamic search.

typeCode.description: Reference to the type of a list.

validityPeriod.description:
Number of days after the last reconstruction of a constrained list according to constraint definition, for which the enumerated list is deemed valid.

Special values:
NULL - The list is rebuilt every time it is used
0    - The list is rebuilt only if any object from one of the underlying entity (portfolio, instrument etc...) was modified. The system performs a check using all entities listed in the constraint definition.

E.g. a portfolio group is defined as all portfolios managed by 'Smith' and with a reference currency equal to USD. For performance reasons this list instead of being systematically recomputed at request, is in fact stored as an enumerated list (although the definition is also associated to the list occurrence). Manager 'Smith' specifies however that the composition of the list should never be older than 7 days. When a request to use this list is made, the system checks that the last reconstruction date is not older than the current date less the validity period.

beginD.description: Date, specifying the begin of validity of the trading constraint.

code.description: Code of the trading constraint.

constraintTemplateCode.description: Identifier of the template used to build the (script) definiton of the trading constraints.

constraintTemplateDenom.description: Identifier of the template used to build the (script) definiton of the trading constraints.

constraintTemplateId.description: Identifier of the template used to build the (script) definiton of the trading constraints.

criticalnessE.description: This critical level lets you decide the degree to which a constraint is blocking when a portfolio manager wants to pass orders. You can access this feature from the order entry function when you run a compliance check. It is also accessible from the allocate order and strategy reconciliation functions.

denom.description: Denomination of the trading constraint.

dimPortDict.description: Attribute specifying whether the trading constraint is linked to a portfolio or to a list of portfolios.

dimPortName.description: Attribute specifying whether the trading constraint is linked to a portfolio or to a list of portfolios.

endD.description: Date, specifying the end of validity of the trading constraint .

natureE.description: Nature of the trading constraint, not yet used.

portObject.description: Identifier of the portfolio or list of portfolios the trading constraint is linked to.

portfolioCode.description:
In the case of a trading constraint associated to a single portfolio, it gives the portfolio to which the trading constraint is associated.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

portfolioDenom.description:
In the case of a trading constraint associated to a single portfolio, it gives the portfolio to which the trading constraint is associated.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

portfolioListCode.description:
In the case of a traiding constraint associated to a list of portfolios, it gives the list of portfolios to which the trading constraint is associated.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

portfolioListDenom.description:
In the case of a traiding constraint associated to a list of portfolios, it gives the list of portfolios to which the trading constraint is associated.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

attributeDict.description: Unique identifier of an attribute to which the type is associated, e.g. the types of an operation are associated to the "type_id" attribute in the operation entity.

attributeEntityDict.description: Unique identifier of an attribute to which the type is associated, e.g. the types of an operation are associated to the "type_id" attribute in the operation entity.

attributeName.description: Unique identifier of an attribute to which the type is associated, e.g. the types of an operation are associated to the "type_id" attribute in the operation entity.

extDenomination.description:
Denomination
It is an extended attribute which cannot be edited by the user but require a data pre-computation (see Triple'A Plus Web TSL Operating Guide).
This is the denomination of the type.
Denomination is displayed in user's language, but if it is not available then the default translation is used instead. At least, if no denominations are available, the name is used.
This extended attribute is defined as "Multilingual" and requires that some languages are defined as "Multilingual" too.

This attribute is used only for the Web Packaging.

id.description:
Unique identifier of the entity.

As for all ids in the database, this attribute is technical and will normally never be seen by the user. This field is mandatory and is computed by the system.

instrNatE.description: Contains the instrument nature of the type. Is used mainly for selection purposes. It is possible to associate a type to an instrument with a different nature if the nature in the type table is equal to 0.

operNatE.description: Indicates the nature of the operation related to this type. It is possible to associate a typeto an operation with a different nature if the nature in the type table is equal to 0.

parentTypeId.description: Reference to the Parent Type (Type entity also). If the Parent Type is indicated, it's actually a sub type.

rankN.description:
Indicates for types of intrument price and types of exchange rate the order in which the prices are taken when determining the "default" price for the day, e.g. close, bid, or ask.
Instrument price or exchange rate types that  have a rank of 0 are not included in the default price process, e.g. fiscal prices.
